title.narrative: Green Sahel in Mali with Stop Sahel

description.narrative: The proposal is part of Oxfam-Mali and Oxfam-West Africa initiatives The project contributes to the Oxfam-Mali programme promoting family farming This project subscribes to the modernisation of family farming, which is a component of a five-year programme carriedout by Oxfam-Belgium on the promotion and preservation of family farming in Mali. In the presented project, the beneficiaries to betargeted are already engaged in family farming, but the mode of operation will be modernised: instead of farming for subsistence, farmers will farm for profit. Entrepreneurial farmers thus produce for the market, and if opportunities allow, they will hire personnel and multiply the systems they have developed for profit. The project contributes to Agroforestry Entrepreneurship in four West African countries Over the last three years, different Oxfam-Novib countries in West Africa have carried out studies and 2 This section is based on discussions with Lindy van Vliet and Bernd van Dijk, 6 and 8 May 2014 Everyone can care for trees and earn: Green Sahel in Mali 12 pilots to engage in Agroforestry promotion. Appendix 3 gives a list of selected experiences. Since 2013, most activities focus on entrepreneurial approaches to agroforestry promotion. This proposal aims to contribute to the stream of initiatives to develop Agroforestry-based enterprises. The OxNo HQ Agroforestry expert as well as the TA supplier PfI are closely involved in most ofthese initiatives. The project foresees exchange visits and exchange of experiences; partly during regular Oxfam-Novib regional exchange, partly by inviting key people from Senegal, Niger and Nigeria to workshops and exchange visits in Mali. The social entrepreneur from Afriqiue Fondation Jeunes in Niger willbe invited to inspire entrepreneurs in Mali. The project will develop a group of Oxfam programme officers with keen interest to bring entrepreneurship in Agroforestry further.

participating-org.narrative: STOP SAHEL, Association pour la Protection de l'Environnement

The Malinese association for environmental protection, STOP-SAHEL, is an intermediary organisation with head office in Bamako. It also has a project office in the district of Nara north of Bamako. Nara is a district whose people live marginal lives. STOP-SAHEL isone of the few organisations involved in improving their living conditions. It works closely with the local authorities (designing community level development plans), businesses (sub-contracting) and other NGOs at both the regional and national level. The core ofSTOP-SAHELs work is to strengthen the organisational quality of community-based organisations (CBO). Over the past years STOP-SAHELhas built up a solid relationship with the people in the region and has gained experience in 43 villages (198 CBOs) with activitiesin agriculture, food security, drinking water supply, soil and water conservation, health care, literacy and organisational development. It has dug water wells, set up cereal banks and tree nurseries, strengthened agriculturalcredit, constructed stone and earthendykes, introduced fuel-saving (wood) ovens, started horticultural activities and gave literacy courses. Local committees were trained to manage the new infrastructure, in order to ensure viability. The success of theprevious project created an interest in neighbouring villages. A co-funding of Oxfam Novib with the EC allowed STOP-SAHEL to expand its activities to more communes in the district, and to more villages.
